newsitem.title: UK: BCCI stigma legal action may hit creditors -report.
newsitem.headline: BCCI stigma legal action may hit creditors -report.

text.p: Legal claims from former employees of the collapsed Bank of Credit and Commerce International (BCCI) could delay a proposed 1.0 billion stg payment to creditors, the Daily Telegraph said on Thursday.
Last week, Britain's highest court gave former BCCI workers the chance to sue for compensation for the stigma of having worked for the fraud-ridden bank.
The report said the expected legal action could involve 2,000 staff, with claims possibly exceeding 120 million stg.
The report said the action would also erode the liquidator's 625 million stg reserve fund for legal costs.
BCCI collapsed in 1991 with debts of more than $12 billion amid the biggest fraud in banking history.
